web.title: Download
web.line:
A web view of the source is available here (~0.5Mb). And there is a JAR that contains it all available here. You will also need a lib directory which unzipped from here (~2.5Mb) and placed like this
jsword |--classes Compiled Java files | `--com | `--eireneh ... |--lib Other files | |--config properties files | |--cookies servlet cookie data | |--jars libraries | |--logs error/event logs | |--styles XSL transform files | | |--page Bible data -> Page data | | |--swing Bible data -> HTMLEditorKit data | | |--test XSL testing | | `--web Page data -> HTML | |--versions Bible data | | |--jdbc Access database pointers | | |--raw Raw format data | | `--ser Ser format data | `--web XML files for the web `--src Java source files `--com `--eireneh ...
However if you actually want to develop with any of this stuff, then please tell me. The source you can see is almost certainly out of date, and it would make sense to share more current code.

You will need a few extra libraries to compile all this lot. If you must compile absolutely everything for JDK v1.1 then you will all of these. If you want everything for JDK v1.2 then exclude Swing and Collections. You can also exclude Swing support by excluding packages that contain the word swing, Servlet and Mail support can also be excluded in a similar way. Clearly if you don't compile with servlet support, then you can't use servlets, and so on. This is not a 100% rule, but it is an aim.
XML4J: from IBM alphaWorks This turns XML strings into an in memory DOM model. You can get it from here
LotusXSL: also from alphaWorks Takes the XML generated by the Bible sources and formats it for the current display. You can download it from here
Swing: You only need this if you are not using JDK 1.2. You can download it here You can use Swing v1.1, but I strongly recommend v.1.1.1
Collections: Also not needed if you are on 1.2 or later. The collections for JDK 1.1 link seems to have disappeared from Sun's site, I guess they want to encourage people to use 1.2. However for quite a few people Psion users and Linux users for example, JDK 1.2 is not an easy option, so the other solution is to use JGL instead. I'd rather save people the extra download for 1.2 though. Anyhow you can get Collections for 1.1 here. Or cheat and use the InfoBus v1.2 download area which is linked
here.
Servlet Support: can be downloaded from JavaSoft here try JSWDK v1.0. However if you are doing Servlets then you probably have a Servlet Server, which should have this.
Javax Mail and JAF: also from JavaSoft can be downloaded from here
All this stuff will all work with JDK 1.1 and up, you just have a longer download if you're not at 1.2.
